Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

validation.validation: Discard on Exit Validation Error

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.

validation.validation: Program Focus is required for [POS]
The Program Focus must be Approved.
The Program Focus must have a Program of Study Type with Category of 'Program Focus'.
The Program Focus provided is not configured for the Program of Study.
You can’t select this campus for the selected program of study on this line. Select a different campus location for the selected program of study and educational interest line.
The Academic Period Provided must be configured with the Academic Unit and Level.
Each Program of Study must be offered by an Academic Unit and Level which is configured to Admit, or that rolls up to a superior Academic Unit and Level which admits.
The Program Focus must be valid for the Academic Period or Anticipated Start Date.
The Program of Study must be valid for the Academic Period or Anticipated Start Date.
All Programs of Study must have an Academic Unit that uses the Academic Period Type given.

Change_Application_Program_of_Study_Even.description: The date for the student application's change of program of study.

description: Element Container for Change Application Program of Study Event

validation.validation: New Program of Study cannot be Fast Path Enabled.
There is already an Active Admissions Application for this Student with this Program of Study/Anticipated Start/External Application Identifier combination
Enter a Date of Change that is on or before today and on or after the application date.
Student Application must be active.
A decision has already been rendered for this Student Application.
The Program of Study must be valid for the Academic Period or Anticipated Start Date.
A change of program of study for this application is already in progress.
There cannot be two Student Application Program of Study Lines with the same order.
You can't edit the secondary record of a match and merge pair after it has been merged.
You cannot change the Program of Study while an Admissions Evaluation Event is in progress.
You must enter at least one Program of Study.
You can't provide a campus location or anticipated start when changing the program of study for an application.
Enter a different program of study for the selected applicant type.
Specify programs of study that are valid for the campus location of the application.
Specify programs of study that belong to the same admitting academic unit and academic level as the original programs of study.
